issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Tooling
components.description: Items related to Alloy tooling and workflow

fields.description:
I get this error when attempting to run Alloy 1.3.0 against TiSDK 3.2.0:

{code}
[ERROR] Alloy [object Object] requires Titanium SDK 3.2.0 or higher.
[ERROR] "3.1.3.GA" was found in the "sdk-version" field of your tiapp.xml.
[ERROR] If you are building with the legacy titanium.py script and are specifying 
[ERROR] an SDK version as a CLI argument that is different than the one in your 
[ERROR] tiapp.xml, please change the version in your tiapp.xml file.
{code}

Obviously the version should print and not [object Object].
fields.summary: Version output on failed TiSDK check is in error

comments.body:
PR: https://github.com/appcelerator/alloy/pull/279

Try to run Alloy 1.3.0 against at TiSDK less than 3.2.0. You should get the error in the description, expcept this time it will actually show the version number instead of [object Object].

Verified fixed.

TiSDK 3.2.0.v20131127194046
Aloy 1.3.0-beta
CLI 3.2.0-beta

Closing.
